pull.title: Docs 0.16 - SHA verification for regular people on Windows
pull.body:
Having people try to learn PGP to verify their download of the core software a bad way to go. If they are on Windows (Post Win 7) they can easily run 1 Powershell command to verify Hash.
Open Powershell (Accessories menu on most Windows Systems)
type get-filehash <path to file>
check results against website:
![get-filehash](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36236431/35980734-766f089e-0cb9-11e8-863e-ad83d2ae3032.JPG)

test: Make ua_comment test pass on 0.16.0

The specific length of the uacomment is one shorter on `0.16.0` than on
`0.15.99` causing the (stupid) test to fail.
Just match the latter part of the message only.

verification.payload:
tree afd7c87c200d0a5febbfe8af7ec8350b2622dd6d
parent da84760701dc08954dfb8cd0639b8fa17a44916d
author Matt Corallo <git@bluematt.me> 1517941973 -0500
committer Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@gmail.com> 1518080844 +0100

Fix fast-shutdown hang on ThreadImport+GenesisWait

If the user somehow manages to get into ShutdownRequested before
ThreadImport gets to ActivateBestChain() we may hang waiting on
condvar_GenesisWait forever. A simple wait_for and
ShutdownRequested resolves this case.

Github-Pull: #12367
Rebased-From: 1c9394ad477d0c1ca0ab1caa6024a7e70c125d15
Tree-SHA512: fb0751ef32d2005520738bf3b0a0f41ae3f9314d700d2a85eb50f023e87e109ce806cdcdf4a08f49a4d9c1001e27df7f461d3fd52b1f5a57885260ce9375260f

events.message:
Fix fast-shutdown hang on ThreadImport+GenesisWait

If the user somehow manages to get into ShutdownRequested before
ThreadImport gets to ActivateBestChain() we may hang waiting on
condvar_GenesisWait forever. A simple wait_for and
ShutdownRequested resolves this case.

Github-Pull: #12367
Rebased-From: 1c9394ad477d0c1ca0ab1caa6024a7e70c125d15
Tree-SHA512: fb0751ef32d2005520738bf3b0a0f41ae3f9314d700d2a85eb50f023e87e109ce806cdcdf4a08f49a4d9c1001e27df7f461d3fd52b1f5a57885260ce9375260f

verification.payload:
tree 9fc055f19e8bf4e6771d3bae44953f1177f21ec2
parent 09fc859ef05adb5a3adac8ce9e60790d99375af5
author Matt Corallo <git@bluematt.me> 1517942334 -0500
committer Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@gmail.com> 1518080848 +0100

Fix fast-shutdown crash if genesis block was not loaded

If the ShutdownRequested() check at the top of ActivateBestChain()
returns false during initial genesis block load we will fail an
assertion in UTXO DB flush as the best block hash IsNull(). To work
around this, we move the check until after one round of
ActivateBestChainStep(), ensuring the genesis block gets connected.

events.message:
Fix fast-shutdown crash if genesis block was not loaded

If the ShutdownRequested() check at the top of ActivateBestChain()
returns false during initial genesis block load we will fail an
assertion in UTXO DB flush as the best block hash IsNull(). To work
around this, we move the check until after one round of
ActivateBestChainStep(), ensuring the genesis block gets connected.

tree abb3edc3c1ec081a0b0aa82796406b84a368c91f
parent 604f289f71a95357d265b274f4ac42d6643530b7
author Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@gmail.com> 1517995859 +0100
committer Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@gmail.com> 1518080852 +0100

qt: Make sure splash screen is freed on AppInitMain fail

The `splashFinished` event was never sent if AppInitMain fails,
causing the splash screen to stick around, causing problems
later.

This bug has existed for a while but is now trigging potential crashed
because the splash screen subscribes to wallet events.

Meant to fix #12372.

Signed-off-by: Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@gmail.com>

author Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@gmail.com> 1517941633 +0100
committer Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@gmail.com> 1518080855 +0100

http: Join worker threads before deleting work queue

This prevents a potential race condition if control flow ends up in
`ShutdownHTTPServer` before the thread gets to `queue->Run()`,
deleting the work queue while workers are still going to use it.

Meant to fix #12362.

Signed-off-by: Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@gmail.com>
Github-Pull: #12366
Rebased-From: b1c2370dde9ade180c638e5d9a4797f085322b5b

author Matt Corallo <git@bluematt.me> 1517943104 -0500
committer Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@gmail.com> 1518080861 +0100

Hold mempool.cs for the duration of ATMP.

This resolves an issue where getrawmempool() can race mempool
notification signals. Intuitively we use mempool.cs as a "read
lock" on the mempool with cs_main being the write lock, so holding
the read lock intermittently while doing write operations is
somewhat strange.
This also avoids the introduction of cs_main in getrawmempool()
which reviewers objected to in the previous fix in #12273

events.message:
Hold mempool.cs for the duration of ATMP.

This resolves an issue where getrawmempool() can race mempool
notification signals. Intuitively we use mempool.cs as a "read
lock" on the mempool with cs_main being the write lock, so holding
the read lock intermittently while doing write operations is
somewhat strange.
This also avoids the introduction of cs_main in getrawmempool()
which reviewers objected to in the previous fix in #12273

events.body:
Something went wrong while creating this PR: it's trying to merge master into 0.16 instead of your own branch into master.

Edit: it would probably make sense to add this tip to `doc/README_windows.txt`
